author: Lori D.
content: I was in for 4 years and was considering a career. But I bailed at 4 because of the verbal and physical abuse. I’d hoped that things had gotten better but apparently not. If someone asks if I’m a vet, I say no. Too ashamed. And that’s sad.

author: Bernadette Peterson
content: I am so repulsed by what the “good old boy system” did to you. I wonder how did they treat their mother, wife or daughter. Shame on them. I have 2 sons, 1 daughter that were in the military, 1 son a CG rescue swimmer and they respect their fellow man and women. Be proud of what you accomplished. It cost you alot, but you broke the barrier and proved them wrong. Stay strong.

author: Phil
content:
No date on this article, but Sara Faulkner mentioned:
Not all survived.

Badass Women in the Coast Guard
https://www.military.com/history/badass-women-coast-guard

author: Bill
content: No organization in the world discriminates, bullys, or harasses more than the military and its members.

author: Peter Wright
content: Inexcusable. 16 years of it and no action, no support. Hold your head up high Sara, let us hope the perpetrators are named and shamed.

author: Doug Bostrom
content:
A state of arrested development, in individuals and then the organization.

Exactly what level of effort is required to keep the yap shut and the hands to one’s self? Less effort than the opposite. Simple physics. Do the math.
